intro: Primula umbellata, commonly known as the clustered primrose, is a herbaceous perennial native to parts of Asia and the Pacific Islands. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring upright stems that bear clusters of fragrant, bell-shaped flowers. The flowers are usually pale yellow to white, with five petals and a prominent throat, and bloom in early spring. The plant has heart-shaped, hairy leaves that are arranged in a basal rosette. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks.
